title: Purse, mid-18th century
medium:
Medium: silk and metal thread embroidery, coiled wire and gilt spangles on silk foundation
Technique: embroidered in stem, knot, satin, crossed chain, and couching stitches with attached coils of wire and gilt spangles on plain weave foundation
creditline: Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf
description: Small purse, shield shaped, embroidered in polychrome silks and metal thread. On one side, a lady in Turkish costume against couched silver ground; on reverse, basket of flowers, with wide borders worked in gold thread. Lined in coral taffeta, with a metal clasp.

tombstone.epitaph:
Purse, mid-18th century.
mid-18th century. Medium: silk and metal thread embroidery, coiled wire and gilt spangles on silk foundation
Technique: embroidered in stem, knot, satin, crossed chain, and couching stitches with attached coils of wire and gilt spangles on plain weave foundation. Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf. 1962-55-2.
